SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Bus
Represents a bus in the vehicle simulation.
Car
Represents a car in the vehicle simulation.
ChallengeHandler
The ChallengeHandler class is responsible for managing challenges within the game.
ConsoleInterface
ConsoleInterface provides a simple console-based user interface by implementing the UserInterface.
DamageStatus
Manages and tracks the damage status of a vehicle.
Direction
Defines the cardinal directions as an enumeration for use in specifying orientation or movement directions within the application.
GameEngine
The GameEngine class is the central component of the game, coordinating interactions between various game elements such as the traffic network, vehicles, and the player.
Intersection
Represents an intersection within the traffic network, extending the generic TrafficElement.
Lane
Represents a lane within a road segment, extending the generic TrafficElement.
MovementControl
The MovementControl interface defines the operations necessary for managing and controlling vehicle movements within a simulated traffic network.
MovementDecision
Enumerates the possible movement decisions that can be made by a vehicle within the traffic simulation.
MovementStatus
Represents the movement status of an entity within the application, such as a vehicle in a traffic simulation.
Player
Represents a player in the traffic simulation game.
Point
Represents a point in two-dimensional space.
Position
Represents the position of an entity within the map or traffic network.
Reputation
Manages the reputation of a vehicle or driver, quantified by a "niceness" score.
RoadSegment
Represents a segment of a road within the traffic network.
TrafficElement
Represents an abstract base class for all elements within the traffic network.
TrafficNetwork
Represents the entire traffic network within the simulation.
Truck
Represents a truck in the vehicle simulation, extending the generic Vehicle class.
UserInterface
The UserInterface interface defines the methods required for interacting with the user, regardless of the specific user interface implementation (e.g., console, graphical user interface).
Vehicle
An abstract representation of a vehicle, providing a foundation for specific vehicle types within the simulation.
